publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6073 Aileen Campbell: Biggar Archaeology Group Members Become Mudlarks at Elsrickle—That the Parliament congratulates the Biggar Archaeology Group, along with colleagues from University of Stirling, which has been doing important exploratory work at Elsrickle, South Lanarkshire; commends this search for evidence about the environment in which Scotland’s earliest inhabitants lived 14,000 years ago; recognises Biggar Archaeology Group’s growth from humble beginnings to a highly developed archaeological team; looks forward to Biggar Archaeology Group’s continued contributions in future excavations, and notes the importance of archaeological findings in better understanding Scotland’s long and rich history.

S3M-6073 Aileen Campbell: Biggar Archaeology Group Members Become Mudlarks at Elsrickle—That the Parliament congratulates the Biggar Archaeology Group, along with colleagues from University of Stirling, which has been doing important exploratory work at Elsrickle, South Lanarkshire; commends this search for evidence about the environment in which Scotland’s earliest inhabitants lived 14,000 years ago; recognises Biggar Archaeology Group’s growth from humble beginnings to a highly developed archaeological team; looks forward to Biggar Archaeology Group’s continued contributions in future excavations, and notes the importance of archaeological findings in better understanding Scotland’s long and rich history. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Stuart McMillan*, Bill Wilson*, Kenneth Gibson*, Dave Thompson*, Robin Harper*, Sandra White*
S3M-6073 Biggar Archaeology Group Members Become Mudlarks at Elsrickle (lodged on 25 March 2010) Jim Hume*, Bob Doris*
S3M-6073 Biggar Archaeology Group Members Become Mudlarks at Elsrickle (lodged on 25 March 2010) Angela Constance*
S3M-6073 Biggar Archaeology Group Members Become Mudlarks at Elsrickle (lodged on 25 March 2010) Jamie Hepburn*, Gil Paterson*
